definition: to clear up the mess/to pick up the pieces
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
to ascend in light steps
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
narrow
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: He was also there to pick up the pieces when his rivals tripped up.
sentences.chinese: 当他的对手遇到问题时他总是可以收拾残局。

sentences.english: Instead, the overriding consideration should be to minimize the cost of the cleanup.
sentences.chinese: 相反，最应当考虑的是尽量减少收拾残局的费用。

definition: to deal with the aftermath (arising from an accident)/funeral arrangements/reparations
terrible mess/shambles
to be fair/to be impartial/to settle (a matter etc)
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave
pinyin: pai1 pai1 pi4 gu5 zou3 ren2

definition: (coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
see 窩裡鬥|窝里斗[wo1 li5 dou4]
to boss people around (idiom)
to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to look for trouble
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
not to get involved/to stay out of it
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
